abstract: As the Fed signaled it would likely cut interest rates, the  U.S. central bank and its European counterpart are  showing diverging readings of the economic tea leaves.
snippet: As the Fed signaled it would likely cut interest rates, the  U.S. central bank and its European counterpart are  showing diverging readings of the economic tea leaves.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Can Europe’s economy stay on track even if the United States goes off the rails?

headline.main: Europe and U.S. Diverge on Rate Prospects

abstract: The deal will bolster Bank of America’s position in the mortgage market while rescuing Countrywide from possible bankruptcy.
snippet: The deal will bolster Bank of America’s position in the mortgage market while rescuing Countrywide from possible bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America announced Friday that it had agreed to pay about $4 billion in stock to acquire Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis.

headline.main: Bank Agrees to Buy Troubled Loan Giant for $4 Billion

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Gretchen Morgenson

abstract: Bank of America will pay in stock for Countrywide Financial, the lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis.
snippet: Bank of America will pay in stock for Countrywide Financial, the lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America announced Friday that it has agreed to pay about $4 billion in stock to acquire Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis.

headline.main: Bank Agrees to Buy Troubled Loan Giant for $4 Billion

byline.original: By Graham Bowley and Gretchen Morgenson

abstract: Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis, is negotiating a sale to Bank of America.
snippet: Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis, is negotiating a sale to Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis, is close to being acquired by Bank of America for slightly more than $4 billion in stock, people briefed on the transaction said Thursday.

headline.main: Bank May Buy Troubled Giant in Home Loans
headline.print_headline: Troubled Giant In Home Loans Close to Rescue

byline.original: By Gretchen Morgenson and Eric Dash

abstract: Scores of investors have sought to profit by buying into troubled financial firms at low prices: so far their investments have failed to make much of a profit.
snippet: Scores of investors have sought to profit by buying into troubled financial firms at low prices: so far their investments have failed to make much of a profit.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America had hoped for a tidy profit when it bought a $2 billion stake in Countrywide Financial and tried to stanch the mortgage lender’s bleeding.

headline.main: Burned by Investing in Troubled Times
headline.print_headline: Burned by Investing In Troubled Times

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Bank of America had hoped for a tidy profit when it bought a $2 billion stake in Countrywide Financial and tried to stanch the mortgage lender’s bleeding.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America had hoped for a tidy profit when it bought a $2 billion stake in Countrywide Financial and tried to stanch the mortgage lender’s bleeding.

headline.main: Burned by Investing in Troubled Times

abstract: Bank of America said early Friday it would buy Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis, in an all-stock deal valued at $4 billion.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America said early Friday it would buy Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender that became a symbol of the excesses that led to the subprime mortgage crisis, in an all-stock deal valued at $4 billion.

headline.main: BofA to Buy Countrywide for $4 Billion

abstract: Bank of America announced Friday that it would buy Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender, for $4 billion in stock, confirming reports that circulated the night before. But one thing remained up for debate: who was getting the better end of the deal.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America announced Friday that it would buy Countrywide Financial, the troubled lender, for $4 billion in stock, confirming reports that circulated the night before. But one thing remained up for debate: who was getting the better end of the deal.

headline.main: BofA’s Countrywide Deal: Bargain or Bad Move?

abstract: With all the speculation this week about a potential bankruptcy filing for Countrywide Financial, it would have taken a brave soul to buy call options on Countrywide’s stock. But there were a lot of brave souls on Thursday, when, even before the reports that the troubled lender was in talks to be acquired by Bank of America, trading in these options went through the roof.
lead_paragraph: With all the speculation this week about a potential bankruptcy filing for Countrywide Financial, it would have taken a brave soul to buy call options on Countrywide’s stock. But there were a lot of brave souls on Thursday, when, even before the reports that the troubled lender was in talks to be acquired by Bank of America, trading in these options went through the roof.

headline.main: Before Countrywide Deal, Lots of Bullish Bets

abstract: Speculation is already buzzing that Countrywide Financial‘s chief executive, Angelo R. Mozilo, won’t stick around Bank of America after it completes its purchase of the mortgage lender later this spring..
lead_paragraph: Speculation is already buzzing that Countrywide Financial‘s chief executive, Angelo R. Mozilo, won’t stick around Bank of America after it completes its purchase of the mortgage lender later this spring..

headline.main: How Mozilo Should Spend His Exit Package
